basics.name: Jeffrey Mei
basics.label: PhD Student in Statistics and Data Science
basics.summary: PhD student at University of Arizona researching correlation estimation in the presence of change points. Strong background in statistics, R programming, and simulation studies, with industry experience in operations research and clinical trials.

work.name: University of Arizona
work.summary: Researching correlation estimation methods with change points. Wrote simulation reports and organized ML seminars.
highlights: Developed method for estimating cross-sectional correlation with change points
Implemented and simulated algorithms in R
Wrote technical reports and organized machine learning seminars

work.name: Critical Path Institute
highlights: Built R package for simulating clinical trials using Shiny
Integrated unit testing into CI/CD pipeline via GitLab

work.name: Allegiant Airlines
highlights: Simulated new boarding procedures adopted company-wide
Automated tools with Python/VBA, improving workflow across departments
Built predictive models and performed data analysis to support operations
Optimized fare pricing and migrated tools to AWS
